==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|し|し|yomi=o}}

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しし}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ɕiɕi]}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{l|ja|師子}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|しし|シシ}}

# a [[lion]], ''[[Panthera leo]]'', regarded as [[king]] of animals
# {{qualifier|by extension from the "king" sense}} the [[Buddha]], a [[Buddha]]
# short for {{m|ja|獅子舞|tr=shishimai}}, a traditional Chinese {{w|lion dance}}
# short for {{m|ja|獅子頭|tr=shishigashira}}, the lion [[mask]] traditionally worn for the {{w|lion dance}}
# short for {{m|ja|除夜の獅子|tr=joya no shishi||New Year's lion}}, a person dressed in [[costume]] as for a {{w|lion dance}} who goes door to door [[begging]] on [[New Year's Eve]]
# a [[guardian]] [[statue]] commonly found outside [[temple]]s and [[shrine]]s, often with a ''komainu'' statue, the tradition for which is said to have come over from the Korean peninsula

====Synonyms====
* {{sense|animal}} {{ja-r|ライオン}}
* {{sense|Buddha}} {{ja-r|仏|ほとけ}}

====Derived terms====
* {{ja-r|獅子猿|ししざる}}: [[lion tamarin]]

====Related terms====
* {{sense|statue}} {{ja-r|狛犬|こまいぬ}}

===Proper noun===
{{ja-pos|proper|しし}}

# the name of the {{w|lion dance}} {{m|ja|囃子|tr=hayashi||musical accompaniment}} in various [[noh]] and [[kabuki]] plays
# the first piece of [[music]] played in a {{m|ja|伎楽|tr=gigaku}} performance {{qualifier|more commonly spelled {{l|ja|師子}}}}
